channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: AI helps India’s Meesho cut some customer call costs by 75%
item.description: Softbank-backed online shopping site Meesho has rolled out what it claims is the first GenAI-powered voice bot among Indian e-commerce firms for custo...

item.title: EV charging platform Ampeco raise $26M Series B, as demand for charging soars
item.description: We last covered EV charging platform Ampeco in 2023 when it raised a Series A round of $13 million. Today it’s raised $26 million in a Series B fundin...

item.title: It's Time to Make the Internet Safer for Kids
item.description: Parent power alone won’t ensure the next generation’s safety—politicians and tech firms must take steps, too.

item.title: Say goodbye to freeform ‘dockless’ e-bike parking in London: TFL debuts new rules to reduce bike mess on streets
item.description: London is putting the brakes on the mess of e-bikes that litter the streets of the city. Today, the local transportation authority, Transport for Lond...

item.title: How Murderbot Saved Martha Wells' Life
item.description: Martha Wells created one of the most iconic characters in 21st-century science fiction: Murderbot, reluctant savior of humanity. Then she faced an exi...

item.title: Google to test plain ‘blue link’ results for hotel searches in EU markets in latest DMA twist
item.description: Google has announced it’s making more changes to how it displays search results in the European Union in response to continued complaints that it’s fa...

item.title: How Do You Get to Artificial General Intelligence? Think Lighter
item.description: Billions of dollars in hardware and exorbitant use costs are squashing AI innovation. LLMs need to get leaner and cheaper if progress is to be made.

item.title: Combining AI and Crispr Will Be Transformational
item.description: The genome-editing technology can be supercharged by artificial intelligence—and the results are already being felt.

item.title: Intel and Biden Administration finalize $7.86B deal to fund domestic chip manufacturing
item.description: The U.S. Department of Commerce confirmed on Tuesday it has awarded $7.865 billion to chip giant Intel under the U.S. CHIPS and Science Act, a federal...

item.title: Best Black Friday Deals on Outdoor Gear (2024)
item.description: Our favorite tents, sleeping bags, backpacks, and other outdoor gear are on sale now.
